title: Vaccines and Autism: Separating Fact from Fiction at Nao Medical

description: Learn about the relationship between vaccines and autism and how Nao Medical can help address any concerns you may have.
cleaned_text: There has been a lot of controversy surrounding the relationship between vaccines and autism. Some people believe that vaccines can cause autism, while others argue that there is no evidence to support this claim. At Nao Medical, we understand that this can be a confusing and emotional topic for many people. That's why we're here to provide you with the facts and help address any concerns you may have. The Facts About Vaccines and Autism First and foremost, it's important to understand that there is no scientific evidence to support the claim that vaccines cause autism. This myth originated from a 1998 study that has since been discredited and retracted by the medical journal that published it. Numerous studies since then have found no link between vaccines and autism. It's also worth noting that the ingredients in vaccines are safe and have been thoroughly tested. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has a comprehensive list of vaccine ingredients and their safety profiles on their website.
